intro: Peucedanum cupulare, commonly known as the clustered cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, upright stems with finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often aromatic. Its small, white or greenish-yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Peucedanum cupulare is often found in grasslands, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and it can thrive in a variety of soil types.
